item.title: Zero Qld COVID cases but restrictions stay
item.description: Queensland has recorded zero coronavirus cases for the second time this week as the health minister urged aged care homes' bosses to allow loved ones to visit.

item.title: More help for the cash-strapped in SA
item.description: Cash-strapped South Australians will get a one-off $500 payment from the state government to help with cost-of-living expenses during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: How COVID-19 is hitting Victoria’s economy
item.description: Modelling released by the Victorian government outlines the forecast impact of coronavirus on the state's economy and traces the road to recovery.

item.title: Lululemon sorry for ‘bat fried rice’ shirt
item.description: Canadian exercise apparel brand Lululemon has issued statements apologising for, and distancing itself from, a T-shirt design promoted by one of its art directors that triggered outrage and accusations of racism online.

item.title: Thousands of airport staff facing the sack
item.description: Thousands of airport goundstaff are facing the sack as the coronavirus pandemic suffocates the aviation industry.

item.title: Rent freeze, temporary visa help in Tas
item.description: Tasmania is providing payments for cash-strapped temporary visa holders and putting a freeze on rent rises to assist people during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Record retail rise as shutdowns loomed
item.description: A rush to stockpile groceries and office supplies ahead of looming COVID-19 lockdown measures pushed retail turnover up by a monthly record of 8.2 per cent in March.

item.title: COVID’s ‘catastrophic’ economic hit to Vic
item.description: Victoria faces a "catastrophic" economic downturn not seen since the 1990s recession due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Chevron told to wind down in Venezuela
item.description: The Trump administration has given Chevron Corp, the last major US oil company still operating in Venezuela, until December 1 to "wind down" its business in the OPEC member-nation.

item.title: Ruby Princess told to leave Aust waters
item.description: The coronavirus-hit Ruby Princess cruise ship has been instructed by federal border authorities to leave Australian waters by the end of Thursday.
